023package org.opt4j.optimizers.ea;
024
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.HashSet;
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Random;
030import java.util.Set;
031
032import org.opt4j.core.Individual;
033import org.opt4j.core.common.random.Rand;
034import org.opt4j.operators.crossover.Pair;
035
036import com.google.inject.Inject;
037
038/**
039 * The {@link CouplerUnique} uses the set of parents and creates couples
040 * randomly from this set. Parent pairs never contain equal {@link Individual}s.
041 * 
042 * @author lukasiewycz
043 * 
044 */
045public class CouplerUnique implements Coupler {
046
047        protected final Random random;
048
049        /**
050         * Constructs a {@link CouplerRandom}.
051         * 
052         * @param random
053         *            the random number generator
054         */
055        @Inject
056        public CouplerUnique(Rand random) {
057                this.random = random;
058        }
059
060        /*
061         * (non-Javadoc)
062         * 
063         * @see org.opt4j.operator.mating.Coupler#getCouples(int, java.util.List)
064         */
065        @Override
066        public Collection<Pair<Individual>> getCouples(int size, List<Individual> parents) {
067                Collection<Pair<Individual>> couples = new ArrayList<>();
068
069                Set<Individual> set = new HashSet<>(parents);
070                List<Individual> p = new ArrayList<>(set);
071
072                int n = p.size();
073
074                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
075                        Individual first;
076                        Individual second;
077                        if (n == 1) {
078                                first = p.get(0);
079                                second = first;
080                        } else {
081                                int x = random.nextInt(n);
082                                int y = (x + random.nextInt(n - 1) + 1) % n;
083                                first = p.get(x);
084                                second = p.get(y);
085                                assert (first != second) : x + "==" + y;
086                        }
087                        Pair<Individual> pair = new Pair<>(first, second);
088                        couples.add(pair);
089                }
090                return couples;
091        }
092
093}
